lexUnit.name: recollection.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the action or faculty of remembering

sentence.text: Perhaps more bizarre is Ms Haddad 's recollection that her husband ` spanked " her ` 22 times " on her ` 22nd birthday " .
What did ` the " truth matter anyway since there was no one left to tell me more about Elsie except my mother , and her recollection of the events surrounding the disappearance were hazy at best ?
The sense of division which exists is a comparatively new phenomenon , at least to judge from the life histories and recollections of people living in the area .
Recollection of the day it visited Millbrook is especially spine-chilling .
A faint recollection of his great-grandfather 's photograph on the quivering , shining , warrior pony came into his mind .
He seemed to have sat for hours mulling over people 's recollections of events on Friday .
It is the grandfather , however , who emerges most clearly in his granddaughter 's recollection .
Such inconsistencies make it clear that the age-regressed person is not actually functioning at the suggested age level , nor is his recollection truly accurate .
Your recollections will no doubt revive a lot of memories for many of our older readers and provide quite a few talking points for younger ones .
Two other grandmothers who came on regular visits , one ` very generous " and the other an eloquent ` martinet " , died too soon to leave more than a dim recollection . "
In appearance everything had been altered since then , and -- so far as looks went -- much for the better , but nearly everything he cared about most was enshrined in these earliest recollections .
She looked up and stared at Melissa in sudden recollection .
I have naturally been very careful not to discover anything about it , but I have a feeling that she has commissioned little tributes from friends and childhood recollections from my sisters .
These may be interpretations of current experiences , predictions about future events , or recollections of things that have happened in the past .
Recollection of grandparents thus appears strongest between women : granddaughters remembering grandmothers .
I wanted to take an event , an experience from my own past , and re-examine it through the recollection of someone else .
It seemed to Charlotte as if she did not sleep at all that night , though her subsequent recollections of dreaming about telephones and disembodied voices suggested otherwise .
She showered , dressed and snatched a cup of coffee on hurried auto-pilot , and was in her car on her way to her place of employment without any clear recollection of having done any of the three .
My most vivid recollection is a gesture he made when getting me to describe my fiance .
Heuer and Reisberg ( 1990 ) , for example , conclude a recent study on eyewitness memory with the statement ` we know from prior evidence that emotional arousal triggers vivid recollection .
Perhaps illness had dulled his recollection .
Of 112 outfits , I had only the haziest recollection of red , pink and leopard-print .
Everything happened so quickly that I have no very clear recollection of what actually took place .
I have n't the slightest recollection of anything like it .
I have a vague recollection that Donald Wilson at first sniffed at Verity Lambert 's ` independent " ways .
She had an embarrassed recollection of having burst into tears , of demanding to know how long the affair with Henrietta had been going on .
Gedge disagrees with Catt 's recollection of the letter .
Certainly Dr Darnell 's account of the trip to Wetherby 's room with clothes coincides neatly with Lee Horan 's recollections .
With a sudden recollection of the morning 's operation , Jean wondered at the number of things Caesar had named after him .
My recollections of the programme are vague , but I do recall Keating saying that such methods are easy to adopt , once understood .
